Package com.xhive.dom.interfaces

This package contains the library interfaces (for collections of documents) and X-Hive specific extensions to the W3C DOM Interfaces, as well as interfaces related to special DOM related data.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
XhiveBlobNodeIf This interface provides access to blobs in X-Hive/DB.
XhiveCatalogIf The catalog is a special library for storing schema documents, which are represented by ASModels from the W3C abstract schema specification W3C draft specification.
XhiveDocumentIf Extends the Document interface to include additional X-Hive/DB properties.
XhiveDocumentTypeIf Extends the DocumentType interface to include additional X-Hive/DB properties.
XhiveFunctionIf Represents a function object.
XhiveLibraryChildIf Shared interface for documents, libraries and blobs.
XhiveLibraryIf A library is a collection of documents and other libraries.
XhiveLocationIf Represents a location in a DOM tree.
XhiveNodeIf Extends the org.w3c.dom.Node interface to include additional convenience methods and X-Hive/DB properties.
XhivePointIf Represents a point in a DOM tree.
XhiveRangeIf Represents a range in a DOM tree.
XhiveSchemaDocIf This interface contains some functions with respect to Catalog items.
XhiveTreeWalkerIf You can use XhiveTreeWalkerIf to traverse libraries, documents, and subtrees of documents.
 

Package com.xhive.dom.interfaces Description

This package contains the library interfaces (for collections of documents) and X-Hive specific extensions to the W3C DOM Interfaces, as well as interfaces related to special DOM related data.

  • XhiveLibraryIf holds collections of documents, BLOBs and other libraries, it also provides methods to create new documents and parse documents to be placed in the library.
    (XhiveCatalogIf is a special kind of library, for abstract schema information (related to DTDs and validation))
  • XhiveDocumentIf and XhiveNodeIf are extensions to org.w3c.dom.Document and org.w3c.dom.Node respectively, you can cast DOM-objects created through X-Hive/DB to these interfaces, and use the extra functionality that is provided.
  • XhiveBlobNodeIf are special nodes that can contain binary data streams (they can be created on libraries).
  • XhiveFunctionIf is an interface that one would implement to apply user-defined actions on Nodes through traversals with methods provided by XhiveNodeIf.
  • XhiveLocationIf, XhivePointIf and XhiveRangeIf provide a (simplified) range-interface to process XPointer results.
